summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and prosecutor Mark S. Cohen regarding the drafting and filing of a joint letter in the U.S. v. Maxwell case. The email discusses logistical coordination for filing the letter by a 7:30 deadline.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an email discussing a draft joint letter to be filed in the U.S. v. Maxwell case, coordinating with defense counsel.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with prosecutor Mark S. Cohen about circulating and filing a joint letter regarding a defense request about the MDC warden.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney corresponding about a joint filing in the U.S. v. Maxwell case, indicating professional legal coordination.

events.title: Coordination on Joint Letter Filing
events.description: Prosecutor Mark S. Cohen emails defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim a draft joint letter regarding a defense request about the MDC warden, with plans to file by 7:30 PM unless hearing otherwise.

keyFacts: The document is an email exchange between prosecutor Mark S. Cohen and defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim in the U.S. v. Maxwell case.
The subject is coordinating the filing of a joint letter regarding a defense request related to the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) warden.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings and logistical coordination between prosecution and defense as of December 2020.
The email includes a standard confidentiality notice from Sternheim's law office, noting remote work due to COVID-19.
